content.question: An object is initially at rest. A varying force is applied to the object as shown in the graph. Which of the following correctly explains the momentum of the object at time <math alttext="t equals 7 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>?

choices.label: The final momentum of the object is negative because the slope of the graph is negative the entire time from <math alttext="t equals 0 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> to <math alttext="t equals 7 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>.
The final momentum of the object is positive because the maximum magnitude of the force in the positive direction is twice the maximum magnitude of the force in the negative direction.

The final momentum of the object is negative because the magnitude of the area bounded by the graph and the horizontal axis is less from <math alttext="t equals 0 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> to <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> than from <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> to <math alttext="t equals 7 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>.

The final momentum of the object is positive because the average magnitude of the force is higher from <math alttext="t equals 0 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> to <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> than the average magnitude of the force from <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> to <math alttext="t equals 7 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>.

content.answer: The final momentum of the object is negative because the magnitude of the area bounded by the graph and the horizontal axis is less from <math alttext="t equals 0 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> to <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> than from <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> to <math alttext="t equals 7 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
